snippet: Rifaat al-Assad, an uncle of President Bashar al-Assad, was forced out of the country in 1984 after attempting to lead a coup.
abstract: Russian officials step up their efforts to promote alternate opposition figures in Syria, meeting in Geneva with Rifaat al-Assad, uncle of Pres Bashar al-Assad who was forced out of the country in 1984 after attempting to lead a coup.

byline.contributor: Hwaida Saad and Mohammad Ghannam contributed reporting from Beirut, and Rick Gladstone from New York.

lead_paragraph: Rifaat al-Assad, an uncle of President Bashar al-Assad, was forced out of the country in 1984 after attempting to lead a coup.

headline.main: Russians Meet With an Uncle of Assad in an Effort to Jump-Start Peace Talks
headline.print_headline: Russians Meet With an Uncle of Assad in an Effort to Jump-Start Peace Talks

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
